      See Also:

    • tile

      private CheckerTile[][] tile
      Two dimensional arrays for checker tiles

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckerBoard

      public CheckerBoard()
      Constructor of CheckerBoard class

      This constructor will construct a nxn checker board (n is specified by TILES). The tiles are red and black in alternating order. Black tiles are playing tiles where the pieces can occupy. Each playing tile is added a mouse click listener. When mouse click occurs on the playing tiles, an event will be invoked.

      Parameters:

      row - Row number of tile on the board for addition
      col - Column number of tile on the board for addition

    • isTileInBound

      public boolean isTileInBound​(int row, int col)
      Check if the given tile specified by row and column is within the boundary of the checker board
      Parameters:
      row - Row number of tile
      col - Column number of tile
      Returns:
      boolean Return true if within boundary, else return false

    • isTileFree

      public boolean isTileFree​(int row, int col)
      Check if the given tile specified by row and column is un-occupied
      Parameters:
      row - Row number of tile
      col - Column number of tile
      Returns:
      boolean Return true if un-occupied, else return false

    • isTileOccupiedByPlayer

      public boolean isTileOccupiedByPlayer​(int row, int col, java.awt.Color color)
      Check if the given tile specified by row and column is occupied by piece with color
      Parameters:
      row - Row number of tile
      col - Column number of tile
      color - Color of the piece
      Returns:
      boolean Return true if occupied by piece matches the color, else return false

    • computeRiskToBeCaptured

      public int computeRiskToBeCaptured​(CheckerPiece piece, int dstRow, int dstCol)
      Compute the risk of being captured by opponent piece if making a given action
      Parameters:
      piece - Instance of the piece for action
      dstRow - Destined tile row number for the piece after the action
      dstCol - Destined tile column number for the piece after the action
      Returns:
      int Return computed risk (CAPTURE_BY_PIECE or NO_CAPTURE)

    • isKingFoundInDirection

      public boolean isKingFoundInDirection​(int dstRow, int dstCol, int rowDir, int colDir, java.awt.Color color)
      Check if there is opponent king in the given direction that can fly and capture after making the play action
      Parameters:
      dstRow - Destined tile row number for the piece after the action
      dstCol - Destined tile column number for the piece after the action
      rowDir - Row direction (+1 is down, -1 is up)
      colDir - Column direction (+1 is right, -1 is left)
      color - Color of the piece
      Returns:
      boolean Return true if there is opponent king, else return false

    • computeRiskToBeFlyCaptured

      public int computeRiskToBeFlyCaptured​(CheckerPiece piece, int dstRow, int dstCol)
      Compute the risk of being captured by opponent king if making a given action
      Parameters:
      piece - Instance of the piece for action
      dstRow - Destined tile row number for the piece after the action
      dstCol - Destined tile column number for the piece after the action
      Returns:
      int Return computed risk (CAPTURE_BY_KING or NO_CAPTURE)

    • computeActionRisk

      public int computeActionRisk​(CheckerPiece piece, int dstRow, int dstCol)
      Compute the risk of play action.
      Parameters:
      piece - Instance of the piece for action
      dstRow - Destined tile row number for the piece after the action
      dstCol - Destined tile column number for the piece after the action
      Returns:
      int Return computed risk (CAPTURE_BY_KING, CAPTURE_BY_PIECE, NO_CAPTURE, BE_KING)
